[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 93]
Reasoning: **Strategic Analysis: A Calculated Three of a Kind**

Okay, let's break this down. Current Blind is the Big Blind with an Ante of 5. My target is 16,500 chips, and I'm currently sitting on 12,168. That means I need 4,332 chips to advance. With three hands left, no discards, and this hand laid out before me, this is what I'm thinking:

First, let's examine my hand: Ace of Spades, 7 of Spades, Ace of Hearts (Wild), Ace of Clubs, 4 of Clubs, Jack of Diamonds, and 3 of Diamonds. My immediate thought is, "Three of a Kind, right?". The Aces (Spades, Hearts, Clubs) jump out. I’ve also got some Jokers to consider. Odd Todd gives +31 chips per played odd-ranked card (A, 9, 7, 5, 3). Abstract Joker is going to give me +18 mult (6 jokers * 3 mult). To the Moon (Holo) gives +10 mult, and I have The Tribe that will double mult if there is a flush, and Acrobat gives 3x mult on the final hand. I need to note that Acrobat doesn’t come into play here because it is not the last hand.

I've got three Aces. So, Three of a Kind using the Aces (S, H, C) is on my mind. Can I make a Flush? I'm missing some cards to make a Flush. So, it is not a possibility.

The Death consumable is an option but I don’t think I need it. It converts the left card into the right. Even with that, I’m not able to make a Flush.

My hand calculation: the base chip value is 30 with 3 mult. Playing the three Aces earns me 33 chips, and Odd Todd gets me 31 * 3 = 93 chips, for a chip total of 156. My multipliers are Abstract at 18 and To the Moon at 10, bringing the total mult to 31. This results in a total score of 4,836 chips. This more than covers the 4,332 I need.

No need to use Death. I can play the Three of a Kind.

Wait, are there other odd cards to maximize Odd Todd? 7 of Spades, 3 of Diamonds are odd. But, I don’t think kickers score chips in Balatro. Let me check. Yep, "Three of a Kind", only the three matching cards score. Kickers do *not* score for chips. I'm going to only play the Aces.

Let’s just double check the hand math... Base is 30. Each Ace is 11, * 3 is 33. Odd Todd is 31 * 3, which is 93. Total Chips is 156. Abstract is 18. To the Moon is 10. Total mult is 31. Total is 156 * 31 = 4,836. Win.

No real risk here. With two hands left, this will give me $2. This wins.

Checking all the hand values again...Three of a Kind (level 1): Base Chips 30, Base Mult 3. Correct. Yes, Ace is Odd.

All calculations look solid. I have to put this into JSON format correctly.

I see that the "Gift Card" is a negative. It gives +1 Joker slot and is the reason I have 6 Jokers.

Final decision. I'm going to play the three Aces.

  "action": "play",
  "positions": [1, 3, 4],
  "intended_hand_type": "three of a kind",
  "estimated_chips": 4836

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

I have $18. The shop's offering is key. Rocket, Green Joker, Celestial Pack, Magic Trick, and reroll are the options. Reroll is out; I'm happy with the current cards. Magic Trick isn't a priority right now.

Looking at the shop, there's one Celestial Pack left, and *that's* the clear winner. I know I saw two in the shop earlier (Turn 94), and based on my previous action, I am back to buy the second one. Buying this Celestial Pack for $4 is a no-brainer with Telescope, locking in a Jupiter card for the Flush. It's an efficient move. This leaves me with $14.

Rocket is available for $6. It provides income, which is good, but I have a tight setup. I need to sell something and I don't really want to. The Green Joker is also $4. Again, I'd have to sell. My current Jokers are: Odd Todd (chips), Abstract (+ mult), To the Moon (interest/mult), Gift Card (free slot), The Tribe (X2 Flush), and Acrobat (X3 final hand). Current build is strong and doesn't warrant swapping to make some income (Rocket) or a minor mult (Green Joker). I'm focusing on leveling the Flush.

The Celestial Pack guarantees the level-up. It's the most efficient purchase.
